• 一般油庫、停機坪工作
• 具油庫經驗優先
• 須輪班工作
上述職位須戶外工作，中三或以上程度，須持有駕駛執照(1-2號)，如有18牌者更佳，具良好駕駛記錄。

About the job:


Assist the Production Manager in organizing and coordinating daily operations of Production Department.
Prepare Batch Production Records, Validation/Qualification documents and relevant SOPs.
Monitor and check records & logbooks in production areas to ensure that they are properly and timely filled out and maintained.
Ensure entire production flows and processes are strictly compliant with GMP requirements and internal policy.
Assistant in developing, implementing and maintaining the documentation system, including the SOPs and other production documents.
Monitor the equipment and cleanroom hygiene according to the approval GMP procedure.
Participate in induction and on-job training to production staff.
Other ad-hoc tasks as assigned by supervisors.

About the talent:


Higher Diploma or above in Science / Pharmaceutical or related subjects.
Relevant experience in Food or GMP pharmaceutical manufacturing is preferred but not essential.
Familiar with MS office and Chinese word processing.
Hardworking, initiative, self-motivated and fast learner.
Able to work under pressure and willing to work overtime.
Good interpersonal skill and communication skill.
Good command in written and spoken Chinese and English.

What we offer:

Career with the market leader in health product sector from Hong Kong.
Dynamic working culture with great team spirit.
Shuttle to/from Yau Tong, Kowloon Tong, Tai Wai, Taipo, Tsuen Wan, Tuen Mun, Tin Shui Wai and Causeway Bay.
Rapid growth opportunities for strong performers.
Staff purchase discount.
Casual attire at work.

Interested parties, please send full resume with last & expected salary and date of available by clicking ‘Apply Now’

Personal data collected is for recruitment purpose only.

For corporate information, please visit: www.vitagreen.com

• 中三或以上程度，略懂英文及普通話
• 持有類別18駕駛執照，具良好駕駛記錄
• 戶外工作，須輪班及加班，提供在職培訓

• 協助油庫運作及管理工作
• 基本中英文及文書處理能力
• 大專或以上學歷
• 具油庫或機場工作經驗優先

Responsibility: 

Performs the set-up, calibration, testing and troubleshooting of circuits, components, instruments and mechanical assemblies.
Determines and may develop test specifications, methods and procedures from blueprints, drawings and diagrams.
Tests and troubleshoots assemblies and/or final systems.
May complete rework on assemblies and/or systems as a result of testing.
Prepares technical reports summarizing findings and recommending solutions to technical problems.
May assist in the selection and set-up of specialized test equipment.

Requirements:  

Diploma or above in Manufacturing/Mechanical, Electronic Engineering or related disciplines
Able to work independently and possess a strong sense of responsibility and understand the criticality of meeting commitments.
Ability to read technical drawings/procedures and use a variety of precision testing and measuring instruments.
Previous hands-on experience with semiconductor equipment, especially with precision motion control, optical-mechanical alignment, and system-level diagnosis preferred.
Strong troubleshooting and analytical skills preferred.
Self-motivated, good team player, customer-oriented and result-driven
Knowledge of personal Computer and Window application.

Interest applicants, please send your full resume with your availability and your expected salary by clicking “Apply Now” button.
All personal data collected will be used for recruitment purpose only.
